message_1: A sheet of paper needs to be transformed into a rectangular-shaped flyer with a maximum area of 250 square cm. One of the sides of the flyer needs to be 5 cm longer than the other. What should be the dimensions of the flyer to achieve the maximum area?
message_2:
Let the length of the shorter side of the flyer be x cm. Then the length of the longer side will be (x + 5) cm. The area of the flyer can be represented as A = x(x + 5).

We are given that the maximum area is 250 square cm. So, we have the inequality:

x(x + 5) â‰¤ 250

To find the dimensions that give the maximum area, we can first try to find when the area is equal to 250:

x(x + 5) = 250

x^2 + 5x - 250 = 0

This is a quadratic equation. We can solve it using factoring, completing the square, or the quadratic formula. In this case, factoring works:

(x - 10)(x + 25) = 0

This gives us two possible solutions for x: x = 10 and x = -25. Since the length cannot be negative, we discard the second solution. So, the shorter side of the flyer should be 10 cm long. The longer side will be 10 + 5 = 15 cm long.

Therefore, the dimensions of the flyer should be 10 cm by 15 cm to achieve the maximum area of 250 square cm.
